channel.title: Writings on Julian Stanley
channel.description: Recent content in Writings on Julian Stanley

item.title: GeneInfo Website
item.description: Introduction to GeneInfo As part of Interdisciplinary Advanced Writing in Summer 2019, I created an educational website about genomics. My aim with the site was to target well-educated, English-speaking adults with an interest in their health. I wanted to educate a broad audience of adults who may be interested in their genomic health due to the rise of clinical and direct-to-consumer testing, but for whom clinical educational materials (which are generally capped at a sixth-grade reading level) felt lacking.

item.title: Interdisciplinary Project Proposal
item.description: Introduction I completed this interdisciplinary research proposal after two weeks of collaboration with a classmate (Khailah Griffin) in Summer 2019. Our goal was to use her knowledge of business and computer security and my knowledge of genomics and biology to create a proposal to address concerns about the security and privacy of large genomic databases. The full text is pasted below. Standardizing Data Security in a Genomic Era Khailah Griffin and Julian Stanley
